page.title: 11BIRD WATCHING AT THE HARBOUR
page.content: Many birds gather to feed on the sewage discharged into{Thurso Bay.}A new sewage pumping works is being built which will pump waste much further out to sea so the harbour may no longer be so attractive to bird watchers. Many species of birds are sighted here but during the winter months it is the rare visitors from northern regions that cause excitement. The most interesting has been a Ross's Gull which came in the winter of 1984 and 1985 and stayed several months. 'Twitchers' came from as far as London and even a Dutch honeymoon couple travelled the length of Britain to see this rare sight. Brent Geese and Little Gulls also visit and we saw a Great Northern Diver in summer plumage on our outing.
